titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow Indian tribes to receive charitable contributions of apparently wholesome food.
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow Indian tribes to receive charitable contributions of apparently wholesome food.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

term.name: Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

bill.summary: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to: (1) qualify Indian tribes as eligible recipients of tax deductible contributions of "apparently wholesome food," as defined by the Bill Emerson Good Samaritan Food Donation Act; and (2) extend through 2013 the special rule allowing a tax deduction for contributions of apparently wholesome food by taxpayers other than C corporations.
